text: William Lester DeMars (August 26, 1925 â€“ December 10, 2020) was an American shortstop and coach in Major League Baseball. He threw and batted right- handed. He was born in Brooklyn, New York. He played for the Philadelphia Athletics in 1948 and for the St. Louis Browns from 1950 to 1951. DeMars died on December 10, 2020 in Clearwater, Florida at the age of 95. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Oakland Athletics players Category:Baltimore Orioles players Category:Baseball coaches Category:Sportspeople from New York City
title: Billy DeMars
